title: Akamai Launches First CDN
overview: Akamai becomes the first major content delivery network, pioneering distributed caching to deliver websites and media faster and more reliably worldwide.

title: Limelight Networks Founded
overview: Limelight enters the CDN market as a competitor to Akamai, fueling competition and the rapid growth of distributed delivery services.

title: Amazon CloudFront
overview: Amazon launches CloudFront, bringing CDN functionality into its AWS ecosystem and expanding CDN accessibility for developers and businesses.

title: Cloudflare Founded
overview: Cloudflare launches with a unique mix of CDN, DNS, and DDoS protection services, becoming one of the most influential CDN and edge providers globally.

title: CDNs Go Mainstream
overview: CDNs become a default part of Internet infrastructure, powering video streaming, e-commerce, gaming, and large-scale web platforms.

title: Fastly Real-Time CDN
overview: Fastly grows as a developer-focused CDN with real-time caching, instant purging, and strong API integrations for modern web apps.

title: Verizon Media Edgecast
overview: Edgecast, acquired by Verizon, becomes part of Verizon Media, expanding CDN services with a telco-driven backbone.

title: AI-Optimized CDNs
overview: Next-gen CDNs integrate AI to predict traffic, optimize caching, and detect anomalies, pushing CDN performance to new levels.
